sentences.english: Rhizomes consistently short necked, culms always forming a single clump.
sentences.chinese: 一貫的根狀莖短頸，稈總是形成一片單個的叢。

sentences.english: In the old days the villages were clusters of mud huts surrounded by high mud walls.
sentences.chinese: 在舊社會，村裏是高高的泥牆圍成的棚屋叢。

sentences.english: When my mother came from England, she brought one tiny part of her favorite rosebush.
sentences.chinese: 我母親從英格蘭來時帶來了部分她最喜歡的薔薇叢。

sentences.english: The roadside of this country has a collection everywhere from the flower.
sentences.chinese: 這個國家的路邊到處都有叢從鮮花。

sentences.english: It is the yellow-ray or solar plexus center.
sentences.chinese: 它是黃色光芒或太陽神經叢中心。

sentences.english: You are the gardener, and I the currant bush.
Eurasian primrose with yellow flowers clustered in a one - sided umbel .
sentences.chinese: 歐亞報春花，花黃色，叢生於單側的傘形花序。

sentences.english: Later that evening, I began pulling weeds from around my lopsided azalea bush.
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上，我在那叢不對稱的杜鵑花叢旁邊拔除野草。

sentences.english: His squeaky voice came from beyond the tangle of saplings and laurel.
sentences.chinese: 在枝節纏繞的月桂樹叢的對面，傳來了他尖促的聲音。

sentences.english: Grass now grew in the streets. And the little houses were covered by wild rose bushes.
sentences.chinese: 現在路上長滿了小草，小房子也滿是野玫瑰叢。

sentences.english: Rose bushes shoot again after being cut back .
sentences.chinese: 玫瑰叢修剪後又發新枝了。

sentences.english: One long column, half-burned, had fallen across the lawn, crushing the cape jessamine bushes.
sentences.chinese: 有根圓柱還燒剩一半，橫倒在草皮上，把茉莉花叢。

sentences.english: The gardener sprayed insecticide on the rose - bushes.
sentences.chinese: 園丁給玫瑰叢噴上了殺蟲劑。

sentences.english: Black and white and disorderly phase plexus, cloud month abandon solitary wong.
sentences.chinese: 黑白亂相叢，雲月棄孤翁。

sentences.english: cluster headache is often considered to be a form of migraine
sentences.chinese: 叢發性頭痛經常被認爲是偏頭痛的一種。

sentences.english: Later that evening, I began pulling weeds from around my lopsided azalea bush.
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上，我正在爲向一邊傾斜的杜鵑花叢清理雜草。

definition: to fold/to fold over in layers/to furl/to layer/to pile up/to repeat/to duplicate
enclosing frame made of bamboo, wire etc/cage/basket/steamer basket/to cover/to cage/to embrace/to manipulate through trickery
